results.name: First prime in the arithmetic progression n+k*(n+1) with k>0.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Dirichlet's Theorem
Index entries for sequences related to primes in arithmetic progressions
example: 109, etc., 43 is the first prime: a(10)=43.
mathematica: Table[k = 1; While[p = n + k*(n + 1); ! PrimeQ[p], k++]; p, {n, 0, 100}] (* Frank M. Jackson, Oct 20 2011 *)
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 12 2003
